displaytitle: Ulysses and Epeus Debating the Construction of the Trojan Horse
creditline: Museum purchase, Laura P. Hall Memorial Fund
markings: Stamp in black ink, lower right: BJ [monogram] [Lugt 381a]
signed: Signed and inscribed in brown ink, lower left: Samuel Botschild. Inv. et del.

titles.title: Ulysses and Epeus Debating the Construction of the Trojan Horse

makers.displaydate: 1641–1706; born Sangerhausen, Germany; died Dresden, Germany
makers.displaymaker: Samuel Bottschild, 1641–1706; born Sangerhausen, Germany; died Dresden, Germany

texts.textentryhtml:
Boguslaw Jolles (?-1912), Dresden and Vienna, acquired after 1870;

sold at auction, Hugo Helbing, Munich, October 28-31, 1895 (no. 75 in auction catalogue Collection B. Jolles);

Michael Berolzheimer (1866-1942), Garmisch-Partenkirchen, Germany;

seized by Nazis in 1939;

sold at auction, Adolf Weinmüller, Munich, March 9-10, 1939, no. 121;

Staatsgalerie Stuttgart, inv. no. GL 3516;

restituted to the heirs of Michael Merolzheimer in 2014;

acquired by Arnoldi-Livie, Munich;

purchased by Princeton University Art Museum

bibliography.citation: Angelika Arnoldi-Livie, Master Drawings 1500-1950 (Munich: Arnoldi-Livie, 2021). , no. 6 (illus.)

bibliography.boilertext: Hans-Martin Kaulbach (ed.), Deutsche Zeichnungen vom Mittelalter bis zum Barock, Bestandskatalog der Graphischen Sammlung der Staatsgalerie Stuttgart (Stuttgart: 2007).
bibliography.citation: Hans-Martin Kaulbach (ed.), Deutsche Zeichnungen vom Mittelalter bis zum Barock, Bestandskatalog der Graphischen Sammlung der Staatsgalerie Stuttgart (Stuttgart: 2007)., no. 115, p. 82 (illus.)

displaymaker: Samuel Bottschild, 1641–1706; born Sangerhausen, Germany; died Dresden, Germany
